thread.title: Busloads from Chicago to travel to Rasmea Odeh hearing in Cincinnati | Opinion - Liberal
thread.title_full: Busloads from Chicago to travel to Rasmea Odeh hearing in Cincinnati | Opinion - Liberal

author: beforeitsnews.com
title: Busloads from Chicago to travel to Rasmea Odeh hearing in Cincinnati | Opinion - Liberal
text:
(Before It's News)
Chicago, IL – Chicago supporters of Rasmea Odeh, a nationally known leader of the Palestinian community, are organizing in a big way to get people to her Oct. 14 appeal hearing in Cincinnati, Ohio. Odeh’s attorneys are set to challenge her unjust conviction on bogus immigration charges in front of the U.S. Court of Appeals for the Sixth Circuit.
Hatem Abudayyeh of the U.S. Palestinian Communities Network (USPCN) states, “Rasmea is an icon in the Palestinian community. She has done nothing wrong, and she now facing jail and deportation. We need to stand with her in Cincinnati.” The USPCN is filling a bus with Palestinians, Arabs, Muslims and the family and friends of Odeh.
The Chicago Alliance Against Racist and Political Repression, together with the Anti-War Committee of Chicago, are filling a second bus to go to Cincinnati. Frank Chapman, field organizer for the Alliance said, “This is the most important political trial happening in the country.”
A rally will take place in front of the federal courthouse in Cincinnati at 8:00 a.m., Oct. 14, and supporters will attend the hearing.
